titleStmt.title: A discovery of faith, wherein is laid down the ground of true faith which sancifieth and purifieth the heart, and worketh out the carnal part, shewing the way that leadeth to salvation : with the difference betwixt the two seeds, the one of Mount Sinai, which tendeth to bondage, and the other, which is the immortal seed of God, begotten by the immortal word, which liveth and abideth forever.
titleStmt.author: Naylor, James, 1617?-1660.

titleStmt.title: A discovery of faith, wherein is laid down the ground of true faith which sancifieth and purifieth the heart, and worketh out the carnal part, shewing the way that leadeth to salvation : with the difference betwixt the two seeds, the one of Mount Sinai, which tendeth to bondage, and the other, which is the immortal seed of God, begotten by the immortal word, which liveth and abideth forever.
titleStmt.author: Naylor, James, 1617?-1660.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
Attributed to James Nayler. cf. NUC.
Signed: "James Nayler. A prisoner at appleby in Westmorland for the truths sake."
